data.text: @Michael73442607 Everyone must make their own decisions. Having looked into it, I do not believe that the long-term safety can be trusted. (ADE reactions have occurred in earlier coronavirus trials).

@AlgernonParry This virus as affected my family catastoficaly, and I could bring things forward I would vaccinate my loved one's but the vaccinations are moving at speed, GP'S can't see people face to face, but can vaccinate its like a money making project
At the end of day its hard to refuse

@Michael73442607 That's the question: what is actually going on? An experimental vaccine, for all /most of the population, to deal with a virus comparable to flu - it doesn't add up. Criminal proceedings may be the only way to stop this madness.

@AlgernonParry I'm not anti vax, but the speed of roll out is alarming, and they are still talking about not removing restrictions until Autumn, there is a plan, and it can't be to protect the health of the population, because other illnesses are ignored.
@SlippedCheese Exactly - for most people, the virus does not pose the threat the Government claim.

@AlgernonParry The majority currently Pfizer’d etc are elderly, infirm, many unable to make own decisions, young folks the same, others from fear, residential home folks, a demographic easily manipulated

What’s left aren‘t vulnerable like the aforementioned, here’s hoping
@SlippedCheese This is good to hear - and runs somewhat contrary to the Government's narrative on the vaccine 'uptake'.

@AlgernonParry This over 50 won’t be having it

I don’t know who will however I’m aware a lot of over 50’s I know have, independently, stated that they won’t be having it

We’re not elderly, infirm, vulnerable, seemingly we’re not stupid either

Different demographic ... may be problematic
3/3  … see International Criminal Court Act 2001 re Article 6.  At the lowest level, gross negligence leading to involuntary manslaughter would surely apply. (More info on my Wix site.)
2/3 … on this occasion (India will not license the Pfizer vaccine). If death or serious bodily injury does occur, it is arguable that those involved will be guilty of genocide - ...
